title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
summary: The novel explores themes of freedom, hierarchy, and mental illnesses through the story of a group of patients in a mental institution.

sub-topics.title: Plot Summary
sub-topics.summary: The story follows a group of patients oppressed by a mental institution, and the arrival of a new patient named McMurphy who challenges the oppression.
quotes: This story follows a group of patients oppressed by a mental institution.
McMurphy challenges the oppression of the institution by outwardly showing his sexuality and rallying the other patients to regain their humanity.

sub-topics.title: Themes
sub-topics.summary: The novel explores themes of freedom, hierarchy, and mental illnesses that are still relevant in today's political climate.
quotes: We believe this would be interesting to talk about as it deals with freedom, hierarchy and mental illnesses, topics we still discuss to this day in our political climate.

sub-topics.title: Character Analysis
sub-topics.summary: Big Nurse is a powerful and complex character who symbolizes control and cruelty in the mental institution.
quotes: Big Nurse is such a powerful, complex character that serves as a symbolic head for so many ideas.
Her title as head of the mental institution dictates her to help the patients, but she controls the patients through such cruel and conniving methods.
